intro: Elatostema jinpingense, commonly known as the Jinping elatostema, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. Native to China, particularly the Yunnan Province, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit with its stems often trailing or prostrate on the forest floor. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation and biodiversity in tropical ecosystems.
